title: Ellie Goulding and Doutzen Kroes attend One Young World Summit
text:
Ellie Goulding and Doutzen Kroes looked incredibly chic as they attended the One Young World Summit in London on Wednesday.

The singer, 32, and the supermodel, 34, opted for elegant trouser suits as they brought the glamour to the global forum for young leaders' which brought together 2,000 people from more than 190 countries.

Ellie nailed casual chic in a white tee paired with a trendy 80s inspired navy trouser suit as she strolled along.

Chic: Ellie Goulding and Doutzen Kroes looked incredibly chic as they attended the One Young World Summit in London on Wednesday

The outfit featured a three-quarter length navy jacket teamed with matching baggy trousers and white trainers.

Her blonde locks were styled sleek and straight while a rich palette of make-up enhanced her pretty features.

Vogue coverstar Doutzen caught the eye in a terracotta double breasted blazer paired with matching flared trousers.

She boosted her statuesque frame with white leather stack heels.

Casual cool: The singer, 32 brought the glamour to the global forum for young leaders' which brought together 2,000 people from more than 190 countries.

Edgy: Ellie nailed casual chic in a white tee paired with a trendy 80s inspired navy trouser suit as she strolled along

Radiant: Ellie looked gorgeous as she took to the podium at the event

Smile: Ellie looked in great spirits as she spoke and laughed onstage

Her caramel tresses were swept into a chic bun while she shielded her eyes from the sun with a pair of edgy shades.

Ellie's appearance comes after she hit back at 'non-stop' questions about when she will have children, two months after marrying art dealer Caspar Jopling.

The star has had a life-changing year, marrying the 'love of my life' Caspar at York Minster on August 31.

But Ellie has insisted she's in no hurry to start a family with her husband, saying she's sick of people asking her when she's going to be a mother in a brutally honest Ask Me Anything section on Instagram Stories this week.

Her words came after a fan asked: 'Do you think of having baby(ies) any time soon? (the world need two of you). [sic].

Wave: The star greeted the crowd as she took to the stage at the event

Wow: Vogue coverstar Doutzen caught the eye in a terracotta double breasted blazer paired with matching flared trousers

Strut: She boosted her statuesque frame with white leather stack heels

She wrote back: Not particularly [grimace emoji]. As you can imagine it's been a non stop question.

'I hate being made to feel like that's what I'm supposed to be doing on this earth. I guess technically I am. But I see things differently in today's world.'

Ellie's wedding to Caspar, 27, was a lavish one and no doubt people mean well when they ask if she is planning to expand her family.

The likes of Orlando Bloom, Katy Perry, Sienna Miller and James Blunt, as well as Princesses Beatrice and Eugenie, were all in attendance on her special day.

The wedding party then let their hair down at a reception hosted at stately home Castle Howard.

Wow: Doutzen struck a serene pose as she attended the summit in London

The congregation were also treated to an eccentric sermon by John Sentamu, the Archbishop of York, which finished with him uncorking a bottle of prosecco as a symbol of the newlyweds’ ‘exhilarating love’.

Ellie recently took to social media to shine a light on mental health.

She said: 'Sorry this is a little late, but I really wanted to say something about Mental Health Awareness, for what it's worth. We all have a right to feel what we do, whatever it is, whoever we are.

'Exhilaration, madness, absolutely nothing at all, confusion, chronic sadness... (I can sometimes feel all these things in the space of a few days).

Something to say: Ellie's appearance comes after she hit back at 'non-stop' questions about when she will have children, two months after marrying art dealer Caspar Jopling

'I am beyond relieved that more light is being shone on the complexity of going from being a touring artist/ performer to going straight back to normality on a regular basis. Thank you to those artists who have spoken so candidly about it lately.

'I know I chose this job but nothing could have prepared me for the ups and downs that come with it.

'I know for sure that a lot of my anxiety has come from what they call “imposter syndrome” not believing in myself enough and thinking that I don't deserve happiness which sometimes results in sabotaging your own success.'

Her match: Ellie's wedding to Caspar, 27, was a lavish one with celebs like Orlando Bloom and Katy Perry in attendance
